gurmukhi: ifg myro Qo nwau eyk dys ko BUp hO ]so qum kQw sunwauN jwqy hau ikrlw BXo ]2249]
transliteration: Dig Mero Tho Naao Ek Des Ko Bhoop Hau|| So Toum Kathaa Sounaaoun Jaate Hau Kirlaa Bhayo||2249||
translation: “My name is Dig and I am the king of a country; how I become a chameleon, I relate the story now;2249.

gurmukhi: nwQ hau qo inqwpRiq sony ko bnwie swj gaU siq dyqo idj suq kau bulwie kY ]eyk gaU imlI myrI puMn krI gaUAn sO jo hau puMn krby kau rwKq mMgwie kY ]
transliteration: Naath Hau To Nitaaprat(i) Sone Ko Banaae Saaj Gado Sat(i) Deto Dij Sout Kau Bulaae Kai|| Ek Gado Milimeripounn Karigadoan Sau Jo Hau Pounn Karbe Kau Raakhat Manade Kai||
translation: “O Lord ! I always used to give in charity one hundred cows and gold to Brahmins; one cow, which had been given in charity mixed in the cows which were to be gifted;

gurmukhi: joaU puMn krI fIT qwhI idj prI khXo myrI gaU qwN ko Dnu dY rihE sunwie kY ]vw n Dn lXo moih iehY sRwp dXo hohu ikrlw kUAw ko hau su BXo qw qy Awie kY
transliteration: Jooo Pounn Karidai Rahio Sounaae Kai|| Vaa Na Dhan Layo Moh(i) Ihai Sraap Dayo Hoh(u) Kirlaa Kooaa Ko Hau Su Bhayo Taa Te Aae Kai||2250||
translation: “Then the Brahmin, who had got the cow earlier recognised it and said, ‘You are giving my own wealth to me again;’ he did not accept the charity and cursed me to become a chameleon and live in a well; in this way I have obtained this state.2250.

gurmukhi: qumry kr qy CUAq Ab imt gey sgry pwp ]so Pl lhXo ju bhuqu idn muin kr pwvq jwp ]2251]
transliteration: Toume Kar Te Chhodhat Ab Mit Gad Sagre Paap|| So Phal Lahyo Ju Bahout(u) Din Mounndi) Kar Paavat Jaap||2251||
translation: “Being touched by your hand, all my sins have been destroyed and I have been thus rewarded, which is obtained by sages after recitation of the Name for many days.”2251.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy kiRSnw Avqwry ikrlw ko kUp qy kwF kY auDwr krq Bey iDAwie smwpqM ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naataak Granthe Krishnaa Avtdare Kridaa Ko Koop Te Kaadh Kai Udhaar Karat Bhae Dhiaae Samaaptan||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “salvation of the Chameleon after taking it out of the well” in Krishnavatara in Bachittar Natak.

gurmukhi: AQ gokl ibKy blB`dR jU Awey ]
transliteration: Ath Gokal Bikhe Balbhaddra Joo Aae||
translation: Now begins the description of the arrival of Balram in Gokul

gurmukhi: iqh auDwr pRB jU giH AwXo ]gokl kau blB`dR isDwXo ]Awie nMd ky pwien lwgXo ]suK Aiq BXo Sok sB BwgXo ]2252]
transliteration: Tih Udhar Prabh Joo Grah(i) Aayo|| Gokal Kau Balbhaddra Sidhaayo|| Ooe Nand Ke Paain Laagyo|| Soukh At(i) Bhayo Shok Sabh Bhaagyo||2252||
translation: After redeeming him, the Lord came to his home and he sent Balram to Gokul; on arriving at Gokul, he touched the feet of Nand Baba, which gave him extreme comfort and no sorrow was left.2252.

gurmukhi: nMd ky pwien lwg hlI cil kY jsuDwhU ky mMdr AwXo ]dyKq hI iqh ko kib sXwm su pwien aUpir sIs JukwXo ]
transliteration: Nand Ke Paain Laag Halichal(i) Kai Jasudhaa-hoo Ke Mandar Aayo|| Dekhat Hitih Ko Kabi Syaam Su Paain Oopar(i) Sees Jhoukaayo||
translation: After touching the feet of Nand, Balram reached the place of Yashoda and seeing her, he bowed down his head at her feet;

gurmukhi: kMT lgwie lXO kihXo qwih so XO mn mY kib sXwm bnwXo ]sXwm jU lyq kbY hmrI suD mwie XO roie kY qwq sunwXo ]2253]
transliteration: Kanth Lagade Layau Kahiyo Taah(i) So Yau Man Mai Kabi Syaam Banaayo|| Syaam Joo Let Kabai Hamrisudh Maae Yau Roed Kai Taat Sounaayo||2253||
translation: The mother hugging the son and crying said, “Krishna has at last thought of us.”2253.
